Items.Title: The City Clerk will call the Charter Meeting to order.
Items.AgendaNote: THE CITY CLERK WILL CALL THE CHARTER MEETING TO ORDER.
Items.MinutesNote:
The City Clerk and Clerk of the Council (Mr. McSweeney)duly called this organizational Charter Meeting of Wednesday, January 7, 2025 to order pursuant to Section 42 of the Charter of the City of New York.

The City Clerk (Mr. McSweeney) served as the acting presiding officer for these proceedings.

Items.Title: Roll Call
Items.MinutesNote: The presence of a quorum was announced by the City Clerk and Clerk of the Council (Mr. McSweeney).

Items.Title: The New York State Attorney General will perform the ceremony of the duly elected Council Members taking their oath of office.
Items.AgendaNote: THE NEW YORK STATE ATTORNEY GENERAL WILL PERFORM THE CEREMONY OF THE DULY ELECTED COUNCIL MEMBERS TAKING THEIR OATH OF OFFICE.
Items.MinutesNote: New York State Attorney General Letitia James delivered the ceremonial oath of office to all duly elected Council Members assembled.

Items.Title: Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Rabbi Joseph Potasnik, Executive Vice-President of the New York Board of Rabbis, 420 Lexington Avenue, New York, NY 10170.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Maloney.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rabbi Joseph Potasnik, Executive Vice-President of the New York Board of Rabbis, 420 Lexington Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10170.


Council Member Virginia Maloney moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor – Veto and disapproval of Introductory Number 1297-A of 2025 -  A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the gender-motivated violence protection law.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women and Gender Equity
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto and disapproval of Introductory Number 1297-A.

Items.Title: Nomination and Election of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.AgendaNote: Nomination and Election of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Petition be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Nomination and Election of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections

Items.Title:
At a duly convened meeting, we, the undersigned members of the Minority (Republican) Delegation of the Council of the City of New York, hereby designate and appoint Council Member David M. Carr as Minority Leader of the Council of the City of New York, for the term which commenced on January 1, 2026.

Signed: David M. Carr, Frank Morano, Vickie Paladino and Inna Vernikov
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Petition was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Designation of Minority Leader

Items.Title:
Pursuant to Rule 4.10 of the Council of the City of New York and Paragraph 5 of the Bylaws of the Minority Delegation of the same, I hereby designate and appoint Council Member Inna Vernikov as Minority Whip of the Council of the City of New York, for the term which commenced on January 1, 2026.

Signed: David M. Carr, Minority Leader
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Petition was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Designation of Minority Whip

Items.Title: Continuation of the 2024-2025 Rules of the Council, As Amended.
Items.MinutesNote:
Council Member Ung moved to adopt M-1 of 2026 in regard to the Continuation of the 2024-2025 Rules of the Council, As Amended.

The City Clerk (Mr. McSweeney) called for a voice-vote on Council Member Ung's motion.


Hearing no objections, the City Clerk (Mr. McSweeney) declared M-1 of 2026 to be adopted.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Continuation of the 2024-2025 Rules of the Council, as Amended.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Adjourned

The City Clerk will open the floor for nominations for the office for Speaker of the Council of the City of New York pursuant to Section 44 of the New York City Charter for the term commencing January 7, 2026 and terminating December 31, 2029.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Nomination of the Speaker

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor – Veto and disapproval of Introductory Number 125-A of 2024 - A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the police department from collecting DNA from a minor without consent from a parent, legal guardian or attorney
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto and disapproval of Introductory Number 125-A.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor – Veto and disapproval of Introductory Number 408-A of 2024 - A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to creating a division within the department of small business services to assist street vendors and reporting regarding such assistance efforts
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer and Worker Protection
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto and disapproval of Introductory Number 408-A.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor – Veto and disapproval of Introductory Number 431-B of 2024 - A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to expanding business licensing and regulatory compliance of all mobile food and general vendors
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer and Worker Protection
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto and disapproval of Introductory Number 431-B.

Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts

Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto and disapproval of Introductory Number 570-B.

Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto and disapproval of Introductory Number 1407-A.

Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor – Veto and disapproval of Introductory Number 1451-A of 2025 - A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the New York city police department to provide the civilian complaint review board with direct access to officer body-worn camera footage and to establish related procedures
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor – Veto and disapproval of Introductory Number 1279-B of 2025 - A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a department of sanitation rule regarding supplemental sanitation service providers placing out refuse or recycling
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor – Veto and disapproval of Introductory Number 276-A of 2024 - A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the wrongful deactivation of high-volume for-hire vehicle drivers
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

Items.MatterName: Report to the Mayor and City Council on City Comptroller Audit Operations for Fiscal Year 2025.

Items.Title:

Items.MinutesNote:
At this point, Council Member Riley moved to nominate Council Member Menin as the next Speaker of the Council.  Council Member Riley's motion was seconded by Council Members Abreu, Louis, Lee, Hanks, Krishnan, and Dinowitz.

51 Council Members voted to elect Council Member Menin.

The City Clerk and Clerk of the Council (Mr. McSweeney) declared Council Member Menin as the duly elected Speaker of the New York City Council for the 2026-2029 term.

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Menin), these Charter Meeting proceedings were adjourned with the Council to meet again for the Stated Meeting of Thursday, January 15, 2026.



MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk

Clerk of the Council
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Menin) made the following announcements:
